title: Tales of My Landlord, Fourth Series: Count Robert of Paris and Castle Dangerous
This select, annotated bibliography includes lists of criticisms of Scott and studies of his reputation
A Bibliography of Sir Walter Scott (London, 1943): the standard bibliography of Scott, it contains listings of many of the contemporary reviews given in the Appendix

An Englishman and His Books in the Early Nineteenth Century (London, 1930): contains a chapter on Scott’s contemporary reputation, especially as found in letters and memoirs of the time; eminently readable but of no scholarly value

The Romantic Reviewers 1802–24 (Chicago and London, 1969): a section on the contemporary reception of Scott’s poetry and miscellaneous prose works supplements Hillhouse’s study of the reception of the novels; also a source of information on the English reviewing periodicals of the early nineteenth century
The Waverley Novels and Their Critics (Minneapolis, 1936): the most important source of information on the reputation of Scott’s novels down to the early 1930s

container-title: The English Romantic Poets and Essayists
title: Sir Walter Scott’
1966): an annotated bibliography condensing the material in Hillhouse’s study and supplementing it with information on the reputation of the poetry and with additional material to date of publication
